Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Nudge \Nudge\ (n[u^]j), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Nudged} (n[u^]jd); p. pr. & vb. n. {Nudging}.] [Cf. Prov. G. kn["u]tschen to squeeze, pinch, E. Knock.] To touch gently, as with the elbow, in order to call attention or convey intimation. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Nudge \Nudge\, n. A gentle push, or jog, as with the elbow. [1913 Webster]

nudge n : a slight push or shake [syn: {jog}] v 1: to push against gently; "She nudged my elbow when she saw her friend enter the restaurant" [syn: {poke at}, {prod}] 2: push into action by pestering or annoying gently
